column4: can I just check, the linux-firmware-nonfree, do you know if there's any firmware in there for atheros usb and rtl8192cu sticks?
I'm sorry, I do not know, I just have a bunch of p54 cards and they need the isl firmware
sorry to bother you again, but how do you use the firmware once you've installed the package? Where do I put it and so on?
it should be detected automatically and used if available (for my cards, there is a line in dmesg that will list when the firmware is detected, or missing)
unfortunately, the autodetection was a spectacular failure
did you look at the dmesg output when plugging in your card?
which wireless usb device is this?
the first one is a Siemens Gigaset USB 108 (129B:160C) and the second is an RTL 8167, using the 8192cu firmware (0BDA:8167)
i'll keep what i have for now then. Thanks for the help anyway :)

from a quick search, it doesn't seem like the ar5523 driver is included in the kernel yet (although the info I found may be outdated), http://wiki.debian.org/ar5523 describes how to build the work-in-progress one (may be better off with ndiswrapper if it is working though)
failing to build? bug 1023645 , seems it needs updating to 1.58 (I don't know if it is out yet)
- brilliant.  Can I attach that to a question I posted?  #211619

ok - i've linked bug 1023645 to question 211619, I'll leave it at that for now - I can still get on the internet, all I've done is reinstalled the headers for 3.2.0-32 generic, which allowed me to rebuild ndiswrapper-dkms against that kernel :)
one minor problem, the bug you linked me to is great - but it doesn't mention where I can download ndiswrapper 1.58rc1 from :)
